messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
There's somebody trying to get into my house. I have my gun out.
Okay, where is this happening?
They're at the front door!
Ma'am, Ma'am, calm down, okay? Is he trying to get through your front door right now?
Yes, he's going around to the back door now. I think he's going to try to crash in.
Okay, ma'am, I need you to stay calm. What kind of weapon do you have?
I have a .38 caliber handgun.
Okay, hold on a second. I'm getting officers dispatched to your location. Where is he right now?
He's at the back door now.
Ma'am, what's your address?
5-1-7-8-5 Portage Place, right next to the fire station.
Okay, stay where you are and do not put yourself in danger. Is he inside the house now?
He's trying to crash in. I don't want to shoot anybody!
Ma'am, please stay calm. We have officers on the way. Can you describe him?
He looks hurt, like he was in a car accident. He's screaming that someone is chasing him.
Okay, does he look like he needs medical attention?
Yes, he has an abrasion on his left side. He said his car crashed.
Alright, ma'am. Are you holding him at gunpoint?
Yes, I don't want to hurt him, but I will if I have to.
I understand. Please stay very careful and do not shoot unless absolutely necessary. Help is on the way.
Please hurry. I'm scared.
Ma'am, officers are almost there. I need you to listen to their instructions very carefully when they arrive.
Okay, he's still at the back door. He hasn’t come in yet.
Alright, we have an officer that just arrived. I need you to put the gun down when they get to you, okay?
Okay, I see them. The gun is down.
Great, stay put and follow the officers' instructions. I'm going to disconnect now that they're with you. Stay safe.
Thank you.
You're welcome. Goodbye.
